page.title: 06A Newspaper Clipping.
page.content: Thornhill lies 13 miles north of Dumfries on the Glasgow road and is now in the main a domitory settlement. People staying there travel to Dumfries or Sanquhar for employment or are involved in farm work around the village itself.The main employer is the estate of the Duke of Buccleuch. The only industry Thornhill had recently was its sausage factory originally established by the Kirkpatrick family.When the family eventually sold the factory it went into decline and it was eventually closed in the mid 1970s by its then owners the FMC.The first industry in Thornhill was mining related,but it died in the middle of the last century with the arrival of the railway.Rail transport was faster and cheaper and horses and carts could not compete.
